communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Virginia Monuments - Governor's Office
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Under the Virginia FOIA, I request:

1. Commonwealth of Virginia, Office of the Governor, Memorandum From: "Ralph S. Northam, Governor, VMI Class of 1981, Former President of VMI, Honor Court", "SUBJECT: Work Plan for Virginia Military Institute Equity Audit", Date October 30, 2020. Consists of at least 3 pages.

2. All records created or received between June 1, 2021 and the present concerning the removal, custody, transfer, or donation of Richmond’s Confederate monuments/statues, including transfers to BHMVA, The Valentine Museum, and the Swords Into Plowshares (SIP) project.

Please include:

Planning/Coordination – Drafts, emails, notes, and press coordination relating to the Dec. 30, 2021 joint plan with the City of Richmond regarding transfer to BHMVA and The Valentine.

DHR Involvement – Reviews, interpretations of Va. Code § 15.2-1812, and records concerning state custody/transfer of the Lee statue/pedestal.

Communications – All emails, texts, chats, and attachments with:

City of Richmond officials

The Valentine, BHMVA, JSAAHC/SIP

UVA (Barnes, Payton, Schmidt, Dubois, Dukes, Ochs)

Renée Grisham, Tom Perriello, Sally Hudson, Jennifer McClellan

All members of the VLBC, State Senator Ghazala Hashmi, and Rep. Abigail Spanberger (see Appendix for names)

Using search terms: “Swords Into Plowshares,” SIP, “Jefferson School,” “Valentine,” “BHMVA,” “Lee statue,” melt, destroy, recast.

Provide records in native electronic format. Please cite any exemptions.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Anonymous.

communications.subject: RE: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Virginia Monuments - Governor's Office
communications.communication:
Good morning:
            This office is in receipt of your request for records made in accordance with the Virginia Freedom of Information Act (§ 2.2-3700 et seq.). Please be advised that it is practically impossible to provide the requested records or determine whether they are available within the five work days required by FOIA because staff time required. Therefore, we are invoking subsection B 4 of § 2.2-3704 to provide us with an additional seven work days to respond to your request. All records matching your request will be sent to you electronically no later than COB Friday, September 5, 2025.
Thank you,
Stephanie Williams
FOIA Officer

title: Rifle inventory records (Monterey County Sheriff’s Office)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Rifle inventory records (Monterey County Sheriff’s Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Records of the most recent inventory of rifles possessed by the Sheriff's Office, as defined in Sections 30510 and 30515 of the Penal Code (assault rifles, patrol rifles, sniper rifles, .50 caliber rifles).
2. Records indicating the number of rifles, as defined in Sections 30510 and 30515 of the Penal Code,  privately possessed by personnel of the Sheriff's Office with its authorization, OR the number of Sheriff's Office personnel with such authorization.

To assist with the prompt release of responsive material, I ask that you make records available to me as you locate them, rather than waiting until all responsive records have been collected and copied.
 
The requested documents or information from them will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

If you would like to discuss these requests, please feel free to reach out to me, John Lindsay-Poland, co-director of the American Friends Service Committee California Healing Justice Program at jlindsay-poland@afsc.org or by phone at 510-282-8983.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

John Lindsay-Poland

title: Police disciplinary files (Douglas County Prosecuting Attorney)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Police disciplinary files (Douglas County Prosecuting Attorney)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

- Any and all lists, spreadsheets or other organized datasets that detail potential or substantiated allegations of misconduct and/or impeached or impeachable testimony, created under Brady v. Maryland and/or Giglio v. United States.
- Any and all records regarding substantiated allegations of misconduct or violations of internal department policy or criminal law by specific law enforcement officers.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Aspen Ford

- Any and all records regarding substantiated allegations of misconduct or violations of internal department policy or criminal law by specific law enforcement officers. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Aspen Ford

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Police Foundations PR (San Diego Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Hello, 

I am seeking records as they relate to the department and donations, grants, or other gifts from police nonprofits, including Foundations, Benevolent Funds, Boosters, Activities Leagues, and Associations. Include local and national police nonprofits.

Documents, physical or digital copies of: 
Memorandum of Understanding or any formal agreements with nonprofits.
Polices related to accepting and soliciting donations, monetary and nonmonetary, and grants from any nonprofit.
Policies or requirements by the department on how donations are to be tracked.
Policies regarding any conflict of interest requirements.
Formal grant requests or donation requests filled out by the department or a representative for the department.

Databases that include spreadsheets or whatever form the department tracks such information: 
Donor name
What was donated, monetary and non-monetary value
Date
Release data in .csv form 

For grant and donation data, please only include items and cash valued $500 or more.
Limit searches to 2020 to 2025

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Officer K. McLaughlin Records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all personnel records and files related to complaints, misconduct, and disciplinary actions involving officer Kevin McLaughlin of the Bellingham Police Department.

I am specifically requesting copies of the following documents:

Any formal complaints filed against officer McLaughlin either by members of the public, or by fellow officers or his superiors.

Any internal investigations conducted in response to these complaints or recorded misconduct, including all findings, communications, and conclusions.

Any disciplinary actions taken against officer McLaughlin as a result of these complaints or misconduct, including but not limited to suspension records, reprimands, and training records related to corrective actions.

Any records detailing the status, rank, and assignment of officer McLaughlin within the Bellingham Police Department.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Safe Community

Thank you for your interest in public records of Belligham Police Department. Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with the State of Washington Public Records Act, Chapter 42.56 RCW. Your request was received in this office on 4/14/2025 and given the reference number P027275-041425 for tracking purposes. Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am specifically requesting copies of the following documents:

Any formal complaints filed against officer McLaughlin either by members of the public, or by fellow officers or his superiors.

Any internal investigations conducted in response to these complaints or recorded misconduct, including all findings, communications, and conclusions.

Any disciplinary actions taken against officer McLaughlin as a result of these complaints or misconduct, including but not limited to suspension records, reprimands, and training records related to corrective actions.

Any records detailing the status, rank, and assignment of officer McLaughlin within the Bellingham Police Department.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Safe Community

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fbellingham-police-department-7784%252Fofficer-k-mclaughlin-records-185028%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAAVjpgQZLkPj-vO60a0SB4kqx8%3A1u4X47%3A0c4T2hfthBhcdaYBlwwWKP_TsDvQjgbguPOnheuxI9E 
Not all public documents are available in electronic format. If the document(s) requested are not available electronically, we will make them available for inspection or by paper copy in accordance with the Public Records Act, Chapter 42.56 RCW. 
 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant department(s) to locate the information you seek and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request. You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. PLEASE NOTE: The State of Washington Public Records Act, Chapter 42.56 RCW, does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 
 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the Public Records Center. 
Bellingham Police Department

Any formal complaints filed against officer McLaughlin either by members of the public, or by fellow officers or his superiors. 

Any internal investigations conducted in response to these complaints or recorded misconduct, including all findings, communications, and conclusions. 

Any disciplinary actions taken against officer McLaughlin as a result of these complaints or misconduct, including but not limited to suspension records, reprimands, and training records related to corrective actions. 

Any records detailing the status, rank, and assignment of officer McLaughlin within the Bellingham Police Department. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Safe Community 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fbellingham-police-department-7784%252Fofficer-k-mclaughlin-records-185028%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAAVjpgQZLkPj-vO60a0SB4kqx8%3A1u4X47%3A0c4T2hfthBhcdaYBlwwWKP_TsDvQjgbguPOnheuxI9E” 

We received your communication from 05/13/25 and have removed the referenced incident report from this request. 

If you have any questions, please contact Police Records at (360) 778-8700. 
Thank you for your attention. 

Sincerely, 
Bellingham Police Records Division 
To monitor the progress or update this request please log into the Public Records Center (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.VEsWrlMiJDg0mXafq1mEXcb3blS7hs0vyK872OuqyGxadeMVHSc9-2FbwSfrjFmiSRs7lHay56l12iurFCVWmn8-2BFzYOVKUFe68K2xqsJK1piVwP5k21OfmBtx9tOjX22XmHiu_cto4pYUGSvA4ESXmhKGvuVI3RNsj-2FtnxlAm9bdcx37ynksljCrcANSmiRTI7-2FOblCby9tMrBvw8ZIMYq0aS0DyubNY5IXql-2BZPCiV8t7h5tSVIy20Q9EvwfaYa-2BEANwST-2FxVMNlsnlKSP-2F1Fo0YOrmTx2JafFdtJrYmtOU9dRzvgqrVDBQJlO94Lv5EHYCdLaQZngSkz75dMLqWA-2F-2B-2FFGCJ8kgyXWNYWrXJremrt5nV7NmGw12Uo4yveiclFGHQDwgI7HvojR9I0h4YHVg3f3YlbwljNvYrs5G1INvo-2FuJNFY37sNfnKjESCk-2BOnrMqid1ks91cL4WJUQZSJgnX8xjGfaSCpXTPEh-2BL8YhXDtk-2BzAENHI-2B7-2Bi9usLA5ORmcx)

communications.subject: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act Request: Connecticut Homicide Logs
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of the State Police's Homicide logs, which should identify case numbers, detective names, weapon(s) used, location of homicide, motive and manner, and any other information the department has listed for homicides. I request such records for homicides that took place between Jan. 1, 2020 to present.

I also request that, if possible and pursuant to Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d), fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest and not made for commercial gain. The requested documents will be made available to the public at MuckRock.com.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alexa Gagosz

title: Records Pertaining to Colonel Kurush Bharucha-Reid (“KB Reid”) (Department of Defense, Office of the Secretary of Defense)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Records Pertaining to Colonel Kurush Bharucha-Reid (“KB Reid”) (Department of Defense, Office of the Secretary of Defense)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

This request seeks all records from 1995 (or earlier) to 2010 (or later if available) referencing Colonel Kurush Bharucha-Reid (also known as “KB Reid”), a U.S. Army Military Intelligence officer who was selected for the Military Intelligence Excepted Career Program (GREAT SKILL) in 1987 and subsequently served in some of the most sensitive Army and interagency HUMINT roles of the post–Cold War and post-9/11 era.

I respectfully request:

	1.	Personnel Records
	•	Official Military Personnel File (OMPF), Officer Evaluation Reports (OERs), commendations, promotions, awards, fitness reports, assignment orders, and internal performance evaluations for Colonel Kurush Bharucha-Reid (SSN/Service Number can be provided if required).
	•	Decorations including: Defense Superior Service Medal, Bronze Star (with Oak Leaf Cluster), Defense Meritorious Service Medal (x3), Meritorious Service Medal (x3), Joint Service Commendation Medal, Army Commendation Medal (with Oak Leaf Cluster), Army Achievement Medal, Ranger tab, Special Forces tab, Pathfinder, Master Parachutist, and Military Free Fall Jump Master badges ￼.
	2.	Program and Command Assignments
	•	All records documenting his service in the GREAT SKILL Program, including appointment, reassignment memos, or internal assessments.
	•	His service as Regional Desk Officer and Special Assistant for Military Affairs at a national-level intelligence agency, with a focus on East Asian and Near East operations.
	•	Records from his time as Commander of a Defense HUMINT Service base in Bosnia, and as CJ2 for Combined Joint Task Force Fervent Archer.
	•	Documentation from his command of a sensitive HUMINT collection detachment deployed to Afghanistan (2002), where he served as the first HUMINT case officer supporting U.S. Special Operations Command (USSOCOM).
	•	Records from his second Afghanistan deployment (2004), where he commanded a HUMINT base supporting surge operations during Afghanistan’s first democratic elections.
	•	Internal records, rosters, orders, or awards tied to his 2005 Iraq deployment as a Senior HUMINT Advisor in a sensitive interagency coordination cell.
	3.	Strategic Instruction & Final Command
	•	Records of his time as Chief of the Military Group and Senior DoD Instructor at a joint interagency strategic intelligence training institution (likely DIA or a multi-agency DoD school).
	•	Materials from his command of the U.S. Army Field Support Center (AFSC) beginning in May 2009, including speeches, directives, or internal comms.
	•	Any documentation of his death from pancreatic cancer in 2010, honors received, or correspondence related to his funeral and burial at Arlington National Cemetery on September 9, 2010.
	4.	Legacy Sites and Honors
	•	Records regarding the 2011 naming of the DIA Contingency Operating Base in Kabul as Camp K.B. Reid, including naming justification, interagency approvals, and dedication ceremony photos or memos.
	•	Materials related to the Reid Center (DIA’s training facility in Norfolk, VA, established in 2012 and now closed).
	•	The establishment of the COL Kurush Bharucha-Reid Award for Excellence in HUMINT Tradecraft in 2014 by the HUMINT Training – Joint Center of Excellence, including award criteria, selection board minutes, and awardee names.
	•	Any correspondence, ceremony documentation, or Hall of Fame entry details from his 2014 induction into the Military Intelligence Corps Hall of Fame ￼.
	5.	Photographic and Ceremonial Records
	•	All official photographs, eulogies, obituaries, citations, press releases, internal honors, or other agency acknowledgments related to Col. Bharucha-Reid, both during service and posthumously.
	6.	Classified and Segregable Records
	•	If any records are classified, please initiate a mandatory declassification review (MDR) under Executive Order 13526 and release all segregable non-exempt portions under FOIA guidelines.
	7.	Delivery and Fee Waiver
	•	Please provide documents in searchable PDF format via secure email or download link.

This request supports a public-interest historical and educational project—specifically, a feature film titled Undercover Patriot exploring the intersection of identity, secrecy, and service. 

As a fellow Parsi Zoroastrian American, I believe Col. Bharucha-Reid’s legacy deserves recognition beyond the classified corridors in which he served.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adil Minocherhomjee

title: Nassau County 2022 general election precinct-level map file

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Nassau County 2022 general election precinct-level map file
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

An electronic map file, sometimes known as a shapefile, with the precinct districts used for the 2022 general election. These are sometimes known as election districts.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ben Welsh

communications.subject: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Beverage Agreements
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Agreements related to the beverage pouring, distribution, sales or marketing rights for campus, athletics venues or facilities.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kelly North

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Scholarship Criteria
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A list of scholarships available to VMI Cadets from any source and the selection criteria for those scholarships (needs-based, athletic, merit, or other). There are only a few listed on your website, yet your website and the Alumni Agencies material indicate there are a number of them available, and even for the Alumni Agencies-funded scholarships, VMI makes or participates in the selections. This makes the information releasable under the FOIA.  If there is a website that lists these, I am willing to pull them from there, but unlike almost every other Virginia IHE, VMI does not have an easily locatable source for this information.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Anonymous.

title: Public Records Request – Arrest and Booking of Brian Michael Johnson (“Liver King”), June 24–25, 2025 – Austin, TX (Travis County Sheriff's Department)

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Public Records Request – Arrest and Booking of Brian Michael Johnson (“Liver King”), June 24–25, 2025 – Austin, TX (Travis County Sheriff's Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act (Tex. Gov’t Code Chapter 552), I hereby request the following records:

Please provide the following in relation to the arrest and booking of Brian Michael Johnson (“Liver King”), which occurred on or about June 24–25, 2025, in Austin, Texas, and resulted in his booking into the Travis County Jail on a misdemeanor terroristic threat charge:

	1.	Austin Police Department incident/arrest report, probable cause affidavit, and any related warrant documentation.
	2.	Booking records from Travis County Jail, including:
	     •	Mugshot
	     •	Fingerprints
	     •	Intake/medical screening
	     •	Full booking sheet
	3.	CAD (Computer-Aided Dispatch) logs and 911 audio recordings or call transcripts for the dispatch that resulted in this arrest.
	4.	All body-worn and dash-camera footage from Austin Police Department officers who responded to the incident.
	5.	Any surveillance video collected from the Four Seasons Hotel tied to the arrest timeframe.
	6.	Property/evidence inventory reports related to this incident.
	7.	Copies of any restraining order, bond conditions, court-ordered mental health evaluation, and any court documents or docket sheets generated within the first 48 hours post-arrest.
	8.	A copy of the mental health evaluation report ordered by the court, if available.

Format preferences:
	     •	Documents: PDF
	     •	Audio/Video: MP4
	    •	Photos: JPEG

If any portion of this request is denied or redacted, please cite the specific statutory exemption.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Elliott Miller

communications.subject: RE: [CAUTION EXTERNAL] Texas Public Information Act Request: Public Records Request – Arrest and Booking of Brian Michael Johnson (“Liver King”), June 24–25, 2025 – Austin, TX (Travis County Sheriff's Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern,

This letter concerns the request for information which this office received regarding Brian Johnson’s booking sheets and booking photo. For case records, contact Austin Police Department. For the other responsive TCSO records, please refer to the email sent to you from our Travis County Attorney’s Office. After examining the requested information we have determined that you may inspect and/or duplicate much of this information, as provided under the Texas Public Information Act. Accordingly please find attached responsive information for your review with the exception of the information outlined below:

1. We have redacted driver's license/motor vehicle information protected under Section 552.130 of the Government Code. The law enforcement records you have requested contain information that relates to:

(a) a motor vehicle operator’s or driver’s license or permit issued by an agency of this state or another state or country; or

(b) a motor vehicle title or registration issued by an agency of this state or another state or country;

(c) or a personal identification document issued by an agency of this state or another state or country or a local agency authorized to issue an identification document.

This information is confidential under sections 552.130, 552.137 and 552.101 of the Texas Government Code. Our office is prohibited by law from releasing this information to you, and therefore we have removed this information from the enclosed information we are providing to you. Normally, we must request a ruling from the Texas Attorney General before we can withhold any of the information you requested. However, section 552.130 and 552.137 allows us to withhold this specific information without requesting a ruling from the attorney general.

You have the right to appeal our decision to withhold this information from you. Instructions for appeal are at the end of this letter. If you do not want to appeal, you do not need to do anything else. Please note that we are only withholding the specific categories of information that are confidential under section 552.130, 552.137 and 552.101. We will process the rest of your request for information in accordance with the terms of the Public Information Act.

2. With regard to the date of birth information contained in TCSO's records, the Office of the Attorney General OR2019-05541 (see attached). The ruling creates a previous determination allowing TCSO to withhold a public citizen’s date of birth pursuant to section 552.101 of the Government Code in conjunction with common-law privacy without seeking and Attorney General ruling. Therefore, this information is redacted.

How to appeal the withholding of information under Gov’t Code section 552.130 and 552.137

If you wish to appeal the withholding of information discussed on the previous page, you must send the following to the attorney general:

1) a signed, written statement indicating your wish to appeal the withholding of information;

2) the name of the governmental body that withheld information from you;

3) the date you made your original request for information; and

4) a copy of your original request for information, or if you are unable to provide a copy, a description of your original request for information.

You may also submit written comments stating why you think the information should be released to you, but you are not required to do so.

Send your appeal by mail to the attorney general at:

Open Records Division
P.O. Box 12548
Austin, Texas 78711-2548

Within forty-five business days after receiving all of the above-listed items necessary to file your appeal, the attorney general will issue a written ruling on the matter. You will receive a copy of this ruling in the mail.

Should you have any questions in this regard, please feel free to contact me.

Thank you,

Travis County Sheriff’s Office – Paralegal Operations
PO Box 1748, Austin, Texas 78767
Office: 512-854-9718
E-Mail: tcsor@traviscountytx.gov<mailto:tcsor@traviscountytx.gov>
Website: www.tcsheriff.org<http://www.tcsheriff.org/>

________________________________

This electronic mail message, including any attachments, may be confidential or privileged under applicable law. This email is intended solely for the use of the individual or entity to which it is addressed. If you are not the intended recipient of this email, you are notified that any use, dissemination, distribution, copying, disclosure or any other action taken in relation to the content of this email including any attachments is strictly prohibited. If you have received this email in error, please notify the sender immediately and permanently delete the original and any copy of this email, including secure destruction of any printouts.

communications.subject: Open Public Records Act Request :: R010068-082725
communications.communication:
Dear Mrs. North: 
Thank you for submitting your request for government records of Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey. Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with the New Jersey Open Public Records Act (OPRA), NJSA 47:1 et seq. Your request was received through the online, public portal Rutgers University Open Public Records Center of this office on 8/27/2025 and given the reference number R010068-082725. 

Your request will be forwarded to the Office of the Custodian of Records for review and processing, including determining the volume of responsive documents and any potential costs associated with satisfying your request. Please note, the N.J. Open Public Records Act does not require the University to create new documents, to conduct research, or to answer questions for information. 

Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

If your request has been denied, you may take your appeal to the New Jersey Government Records Council (NJGRC), which has mediation and dispute resolution procedures, or you may file a lawsuit with the New Jersey Superior Court, as provided by N.J.S.A. 47:1A-1, et seq. Your rights of appeal is provided with this letter at Public Facing Pages of the Rutgers University Open Public Records Request Center . You may also review the brochure at the Rutgers Custodian of Records page or visit the  NJGRC page. 
If you have any questions, or wish to discuss this further, you may contact my office. 
Sincerely, 
Mary Ann Keys 
Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Board of Professional Conduct
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I was seeking copies any and all DEA OPR investigation reports referred to the Board of Professional Conduct for disciplinary recommendations for the years 2015 -2019.  This information and procedures and data is highly publicized as cited in the related hyperlinked news. Produce the reports in a properly redacted format on par with other agencies who regularly make these types of disclosures. 

US Government sponsors bill to cease false narratives / Fake News
https://news.un.org/en/story/2022/04/1115412

DEA RFP Case Management Systems and Failures
Notice ID IST-1234

“Current technical capabilities for information tracking, sharing, and analysis are limited by the design of the current toolset utilized as the primary work enablers for ISTA. These applications were not designed to provide high levels of confidentiality, integrity, or accessibility for those with a need to know; nor where they intended to be the backbone of significant analytical and business processing activities in a high operational tempo (OPTEMPO) office. As workloads increase, the technology becomes a limiting factor for maturing ISTA in a way that would ensure increased capabilities in the mission to detect, deter, and mitigate insider threats.
https://etc.g2xchange.com/statics/doj-rfi-dea-case-management-system/

Review of the Drug 
Enforcement 
Administration’s 
Disciplinary System 
Report Number 
I-2004-002
https://oig.justice.gov/reports/DEA/e0402/final.pdf

DEA agents kept jobs despite serious misconduct
Brad Heath, and Meghan HoyerUSA TODAY

https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/2015/09/27/few-dea-agents-fired-misconduct/72805622/

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

William Fernandes

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Board of Professional Conduct
communications.communication:
I'm sorry I didn't get to connect with you on Office Day Monday's about this request.  But I wanted to offer some Adobo.  You are welcomed to narrow the request to 200 pages. You can spice up 50 pages per year or even send 200 pages from the 4 years that were selected to 'not have disciplinary action taken'.

Best,
William

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Vernor Steffen Vinge (October 2, 1944 – March 20, 2024)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry into science fiction writer and mathematics professor Vernor Steffen Vinge (October 2, 1944 – March 20, 2024). His death is widely-known and widely reported; as such, privacy concerns under FOIA Exemptions 6 and 7 are voided, as are any concerns under the Privacy Act. For example, you may find his obituary at the following link: https://arstechnica.com/information-technology/2024/03/vernor-vinge-father-of-the-tech-singularity-has-died-at-age-79/

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records of both HQ and all field offices for all relevant names, agencies, organizations, companies and events including but not limited to those cited in the previous paragraphs and/or links as well as a cross-reference with the Southern Poverty Law Center to include any information provided by the SPLC. My request includes but is not limited to 137, 157, 176, 177, 183, 184, 188, and 214 files. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

If any part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to review and release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of responsive documents, as the FOIA requires.

I request that I be properly classified as a media requester. I am an assistant editor at Reason Magazine who has written numerous articles on topics of public interest for the Daily Beast, the Asia Times, Responsible Statecraft, the National Interest, Reason Magazine, America Magazine and the Armenian Weekly, and I am requesting these documents in an editorial capacity. Please contact me if you have any questions about my media status.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email

requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

**

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBIâ€™s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBIâ€™s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the â€˜Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request toolâ€™ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Vermont Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Agreements related to the beverage pouring, distribution, sales or marketing rights for campus, athletics venues or facilities.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Sincerely,

Kelly North

communications.subject: RE: Vermont Public Records Act Request: Beverage Agreements [PRA 20250822 North]
communications.communication:
Dear Kelly,

I’m writing in response to your request for records received by our office on August 22, 2025 and am confirming that it is in process. The Vermont Public Records Act requires a response no later than three business days, which, based on when we received your request, is August 27, 2025. Due to the location of records that must be reviewed to respond to your request and because I must consult with other departments with substantial interest in the determination of the request, I am notifying you of our need to extend under 1 V.S.A. § 318(a)(5) our time for response to up to ten business days from the date of your request. Therefore, you will receive our response to your request by September 8, 2025. I’ll send any updates as they become available in the meanwhile.

Sincerely,

Office of Compliance and Privacy Services
University of Vermont

Chicago Public Schools (CPS) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. 
Due to the volume and complexity of requests received in the normal course of business, CPS is extending the time for its initial response to your request by an additional 5 business days (to 10 business days total beginning on the first business day following receipt of the request) pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/3(e)(v) which allows for the examination and evaluation of the requested records by personnel to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of Illinois FOIA or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions. 
Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. All applicable fees must be paid prior to the copying. CPS will inform you of any fees due if your paper response exceeds 50 pages. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the CPS FOIA Center.

communications.subject: Non-Commercial FOIA Request :: N017680-061125
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
August 28, 2025 Miriam Bhimani RE: Chicago Public Schools (CPS) FOIA Request N017680-061125 Dear Miriam Bhimani: This letter is in reply to your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request seeking the following information: Based on the annual membership file as of June 9, 2025, records sufficient to show the following: 
Anonymized student data including SCHOOL_ID broken down by Homeroom. 
For each SCHOOL_ID, there should be breakdowns by Homeroom. RESPONSE : In the spirit of cooperation, documents responsive to your FOIA request are available to download via the CPS FOIA Center. Please visit the link and enter your username and password to access the records: http://cps.edu/About_CPS/Departments/Law/Pages/FOIARequest.aspx . This data was pulled as of point in time, June 9, 2025. Be advised that providing the data you seek “based on annual membership file as of June 9, 2025” would require the district to create records that are not maintained in the regular course of business. Data analysts would be required to pull each portion of your request; datasets would have to be joined, and the data would have to be verified in order to create the record you seek. This process is not required according to guidance provided by 5 ILCS 140/2(c). 5 ILCS 140/1, Kenyon v. Garrels, 184 Ill. App. 3d 28, 32 (4 th Dist. 1989), and Yeager v. Drug Enforcement Admin., 678 F. 2d 315, 321 (D.C. Cir. 1982). Additionally, under Illinois FOIA law, a request to inspect or copy a record must reasonably identify a public record, as opposed to general data, information or statistics to be gleaned from documents which have not otherwise been created by a public body. Accordingly, FOIA applies to the provision of existing public records; a public body is not required to answer questions or generate new records in response to a FOIA request. Further, Section 1 of the FOIA states in part: "This Act is not intended to create an obligation on the part of any public body to maintain or prepare any public record which was not maintained or prepared by such public body at the time when this Act becomes effective, except as otherwise required by applicable local, State or federal law." In accordance with Section 1 of Illinois FOIA, the District is not required to conduct research to answer questions or prepare researched records in response to a specific query [5 ILCS 140/1]. To the extent you consider this a denial, pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a) you may file a Request for Review with the Public Access Counselor (PAC) at: Public Access Counselor; Office of the Attorney General; 500 South 2nd Street; Springfield, IL 62706. You also have the right to seek judicial review of your denial by filing a lawsuit in the State circuit court, 5 ILCS 140/11. If you choose to file a Request for Review with the PAC, you must do so within 60 calendar days of the date of this denial letter. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). Please note that you must include a copy of your original FOIA request and this denial letter when filing a Request for Review with the PAC. 
Thank you for your request. Sincerely, 
Ana Diaz Freedom of Information Act Officer Chicago Public Schools

title: University Anti-Semitism Response Policies (University of California, San Diego)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: University Anti-Semitism Response Policies (University of California, San Diego)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern at {agency name}: 

This is a request for the following records pursuant to the {law name}. I hereby request the following records: 

1. Any written or recorded {agency name} policies (including, without limitation, university guidance, orientation programs, handbooks, manuals, standards, speech codes, and/or internal memoranda) issued and/or updated following President Trump’s January 29, 2025 Executive Order 14188* that include any of the following terms (and/or any variations of these terms):
a) discrimination 
b) harassment
c) hostile 
d) campus safety
e) Anti-Semitism
f) International Holocaust Remembrance Alliance (IHRA) 
g) Anti-Semitism Awareness Act 

*The executive order can be found here:
https://www.federalregister.gov/documents/2025/02/03/2025-02230/additional-measures-to-combat-anti-semitism

2. Any written or recorded internal communications (including, without limitation, staff meeting minutes, emails, internal instant messaging records, and/or internal memoranda) that reference the above-mentioned executive order and include any of the following terms (and/or any variations of these terms):
a) discrimination 
b) harassment
c) hostile 
d) campus safety
e) investigation
f) Anti-Semitism
g) International Holocaust Remembrance Alliance (IHRA) 
h) Anti-Semitism Awareness Act 

Fee waiver request: {waiver}. This request is made on behalf of the Foundation for Individual Rights and Expression, a nonprofit and nonpartisan organization that aims to defend and sustain the individual rights of all Americans to free speech and free thought. We request a waiver of any fees or costs associated with this request.

This request concerns a matter of public interest. It is important that we access these public records in order to effectively advocate for students and staff at the {agency name}. The records are not sought for a commercial or personal interest, but rather for the purpose of providing the public with information concerning civil liberties in higher education. 

If you elect to charge a fee, please provide a cost estimate for each category of documents requested. Please also provide me with a W-9 form.

Request for expedited processing: The records pertain to a matter of public importance and current debate. Providing expedited production of the records will facilitate the public understanding of these matters before they are fully resolved. Any undue delay in production will undermine the purpose of the public records laws, which serve to allow public input and oversight of government affairs. In any event, {short name} law requires that a request be acted upon in {days} days.

Additionally, if any specific categories of requested records will require a significantly longer production time than those in other categories, please provide records for each category on a piecemeal basis as they become available. 

Request for Privilege Log: If any otherwise responsive documents are withheld on the basis that they are privileged or fall within a statutory exemption, please provide a privilege log setting forth (1) the subject matter of the document; (2) the person(s) who sent and received the document; (3) the date the document was created or sent; and (4) the basis on which the document is withheld.

Please note that this request does not seek a search of faculty or student email accounts or records. These requests should in no way be construed to include a review or search of email accounts, websites, or other forms of data or document retention which are controlled by students, alumni, or faculty members, nor by governmental or advisory bodies controlled by the same, except insofar as any such individuals also serve in an administrative capacity and the records were created or are held by the individual in that capacity. Any search should be limited to documents held by the administration and/or its staff members, including records created or maintained by persons acting in the capacity of administrators or staff members.

communications.subject: :: R010333-082525
communications.communication:
Dear Charlotte Arneson: 
 
Thank you for your interest in public records of UC San Diego. Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with relevant law and University policy. Your request was given the reference number R010333-082525 for tracking purposes. Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern at {agency name}:

This is a request for the following records pursuant to the {law name}. I hereby request the following records:

1. Any written or recorded {agency name} policies (including, without limitation, university guidance, orientation programs, handbooks, manuals, standards, speech codes, and/or internal memoranda) issued and/or updated following President Trump’s January 29, 2025 Executive Order 14188* that include any of the following terms (and/or any variations of these terms):
a) discrimination
b) harassment
c) hostile
d) campus safety
e) Anti-Semitism
f) International Holocaust Remembrance Alliance (IHRA)
g) Anti-Semitism Awareness Act

*The executive order can be found here:
https://www.federalregister.gov/documents/2025/02/03/2025-02230/additional-measures-to-combat-anti-semitism

2. Any written or recorded internal communications (including, without limitation, staff meeting minutes, emails, internal instant messaging records, and/or internal memoranda) that reference the above-mentioned executive order and include any of the following terms (and/or any variations of these terms):
a) discrimination
b) harassment
c) hostile
d) campus safety
e) investigation
f) Anti-Semitism
g) International Holocaust Remembrance Alliance (IHRA)
h) Anti-Semitism Awareness Act

Fee waiver request: {waiver}. This request is made on behalf of the Foundation for Individual Rights and Expression, a nonprofit and nonpartisan organization that aims to defend and sustain the individual rights of all Americans to free speech and free thought. We request a waiver of any fees or costs associated with this request.

This request concerns a matter of public interest. It is important that we access these public records in order to effectively advocate for students and staff at the {agency name}. The records are not sought for a commercial or personal interest, but rather for the purpose of providing the public with information concerning civil liberties in higher education.

If you elect to charge a fee, please provide a cost estimate for each category of documents requested. Please also provide me with a W-9 form.

Request for expedited processing: The records pertain to a matter of public importance and current debate. Providing expedited production of the records will facilitate the public understanding of these matters before they are fully resolved. Any undue delay in production will undermine the purpose of the public records laws, which serve to allow public input and oversight of government affairs. In any event, {short name} law requires that a request be acted upon in {days} days.

Additionally, if any specific categories of requested records will require a significantly longer production time than those in other categories, please provide records for each category on a piecemeal basis as they become available.

Request for Privilege Log: If any otherwise responsive documents are withheld on the basis that they are privileged or fall within a statutory exemption, please provide a privilege log setting forth (1) the subject matter of the document; (2) the person(s) who sent and received the document; (3) the date the document was created or sent; and (4) the basis on which the document is withheld.

Please note that this request does not seek a search of faculty or student email accounts or records. These requests should in no way be construed to include a review or search of email accounts, websites, or other forms of data or document retention which are controlled by students, alumni, or faculty members, nor by governmental or advisory bodies controlled by the same, except insofar as any such individuals also serve in an administrative capacity and the records were created or are held by the individual in that capacity. Any search should be limited to documents held by the administration and/or its staff members, including records created or maintained by persons acting in the capacity of administrators or staff members.

If I can be of assistance in interpreting or narrowing this request, please don’t hesitate to ask.

Best,

{name}

Charlotte Arneson
Program Counsel, Campus Rights Advocacy
Foundation for Individual Rights and Expression (FIRE)
700 Pennsylvania Avenue, Southeast, Suite 340
Washington, D.C. 20003
Ph: 215-717-3473 ext. 263
thefire.org

Your request will be forwarded to the relevant department(s) to locate the information you seek and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request. You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. title: FBI support for 2022 BBC Two series "Stolen: Catching the Art Thieves"

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI support for 2022 BBC Two series "Stolen: Catching the Art Thieves"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents pertaining to FBI support for or collaboration with the production of the 2022 BBC Two series "Stolen: Catching the Art Thieves." Such documents may include, but are not limited to, script notes; production assistance agreements; and all records of communications between employees of the FBI and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "Stolen: Catching the Art Thieves," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication. I request a search of all locations where such documents might be located, including but not limited to the entertainment liaison offices and communications HQ or similar offices.

Attached is a document, released to me by the FBI in response to a previous FOIA request, confirming that the FBI supported the production of "Stolen: Catching the Art Thieves." 

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1661626-000
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern,

This appeal concerns FOIA request 1661626-000, which I made to the FBI, requesting documents pertaining to FBI support for the production of the TV series "Stolen: Catching the Art Thieves."

The name of the Lion Television Limited representative who signed the production assistance agreement you released is redacted. To justify the redactions as a whole, the response letter cites statues b(6), b(7)(C), and b(7)(E) under FOIPA, Title 5, United States Code Section 552/552a. I am appealing the invocations of b(7)(C), and b(7)(E), which I believe are inappropriate with regard to many of these redactions.

Statutes b(6) and (7)(C) is meant to protect personal privacy. This document pertains to FBI assistance with a TV production. The third-party individual whose name is redacted was not acting as a private individuals but as members of a production team. Thus, the third-party individual whose signature is redacted, I argue, could not have reasonably expected these communications to be private, nor for the FBI to hide their names. Furthermore, the disclosure of this information would be in the public interest, as it would shed additional light on the close relationship between Washington D.C.--and the FBI in particular--and the entertainment industry.

Statute b(7)(E) is meant to keep law enforcement techniques and procedures private in the event that disclosure could lead to circumvention of the law. This does not apply here at all.

I therefore request a further review of this redaction and a new release of the same document without the redaction of the third-party name of the signatory.

Respectfully,
Brett Carollo

communications.subject: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request: Beverage Agreements
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Missouri Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Agreements related to the beverage pouring rights, distribution, or sales on campus or in athletics venues or facilities. Including any related exclusive marketing agreements for beverage brands in those areas.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kelly North

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Police data collection (2017-2022) (Puyallup Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. the total number of police use of force incidents reported from 2017-2022, separated by year.

2. the total number of police use of force incidents, separated by type of force and year, from 2017-2022 (for example, information that specifies the number of taser incidents in 2022, baton incidents in 2022, taser incidents in 2021, baton incidents in 2021, etc.)

3. the total number of civilian complaints against law enforcement that were reported and the total number sustained from 2017-2022, separated by year.

4. the total number of civilian complaints alleging law enforcement use of excessive force that were reported and the total number sustained from 2017-2022, separated by year.

5. the total number of civilian complaints alleging biased policing or racial profiling that were reported and the total number sustained from 2017-2022, separated by year.

6. the total number of civilian complaints alleging criminal conduct that were reported and the total number sustained from 2017-2022, separated by year.

7. the total number of officer-involved shootings from 2017-2022, both fatal and non-fatal, separated by year.

8. the total number of people who police used force against in 2022, broken down by race/ethnicity.

When available, I would appreciate being sent individualized data in this request in spreadsheet format. If individualized data are unavailable, please send information that includes aggregate statistics for the item instead.

Note that my requests for civilian complaints are specifically for civilian complaints, please do not include complaints filed by one officer/the department against another officer.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Samuel Sinyangwe

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: BOV EXCOM 24 Oct 2022
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. All slides and materials presented or given to the BOV Members for or at the October 24, 2022 BOV Executive Committee meeting. The Minutes reflected these covered a number of topics, including "Inclusive Excellence training, admissions efforts, and the marketing and branding of VMI." The admissions and Inclusive Excellence were termed extensive "deep dive" presentations. 

2. Additionally, an audio recording appears to have been given to The Washington Post. If a transcript of the recording was made, I request a copy of that transcript, as well as the audio recording.

3. The minutes and other information five-year Strategic Enrollment Plan with performance metrics and so I would like a copy of that.

4. There was also an October 26, 2022 "Update" from BOV President Mr. Tom Watjen that I can no longer locate and may have been taken down.

5. There sis also mention of a "letter to alumni about one of the speakers mentioned in the BOV Meeting named "Kimberly Dark" and there seems to be some controversy. In references to the letter Maj. Gen. Wins mentioned something about "there has been a group of unhappy alumni who want to stoke the worst fears and sow seeds of discord about the training and education of students here.” but as with the others I can no longer find that letter on the VMI website so it may have change location. I would like the link so I have everything discussed at that meeting. There was also a mention that the presentation was videotaped and posted somewhere?

Although there are references to these in various areas, the VMI BOV Website now no longer provides the records from the 2022 BOV Meetings (on the Main site or dashboard), so I could not access them there.

These should all be readily available.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Anonymous.

communications.subject: RE: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request #25-103
communications.communication:
Although I do not agree with the fee being charged in order to complete the research expeditiously, I will make payment if you decline my appeal of the fee (below)

Although I've yet to locate any fee table on your website, it is my understanding that VMI typically automatically waives any fees that are approximately $55. If so, the cost is only $3.16 more. If the automatic waiver level is $50, then this is only $8.19 above that. If this is incorrect, please provide me with VMI's officially published fee waiver in these areas.

VMI posts BOV Records to its website for free download.  The situation is just that it is not posting the year of this (and my other) request. While it is reasonable that some search would be required for older records before the BOV transitioned to electronic records, it is also reasonable that these should be readily available in electronic form and should be provided at no cost.

By § 2.2-3707. Meetings to be public; notice of meetings; recordings; minutes G.: "At least one copy of the proposed agenda and all agenda packets and, unless exempt, all materials furnished to members of a public body for a meeting shall be made available for public inspection at the same time such documents are furnished to the members of the public body." While VMI appears to be complaint with this through its "dashboard" on the BOV website for recent meetings, this is not available for the 2021 and 2022 meeting . The statute does not contain any requirement that these materials must be requested at the time of the meeting, only that they should be available to the public as of "at the same time such documents are furnished to members of the public body."

Finally, if you decline my appeal of the fee charged, I kindly request that you complete the request form while I arrange payment. VMIU's published FOIA guidelines state: "If we estimate that it will cost more than $200 to respond to your request, we may require a deposit, not to exceed the estimated amount, before proceeding with your request.  The five days we have to respond to your request do not include the time between when we request a deposit and when you respond." This is well below $200, and filling it should not be held waiting for payment.

Thank you for your time in reviewing this and I look forward to your response.

communications.subject: RE: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request #25-103
communications.communication: Your sarcastic comment, "and easily found via Google," is unprofessional and unnecessary. The simple question was that the link did not work, and you should assume we attempted various means to find the record before simply asking you for it. As a point of reference, Virginia FOIA law requires that all records made available to Boards be available to the public at the same time the Board receives them, so it is reasonable for anyone to assume that the agency would maintain important records (like BOV Briefing attachments, enclosures, etc.)  associated with their minutes.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: DCI Records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Records reflecting budgets and amounts actually spent by the U.S. Marine Corps and/or the USMC Drum and Bugle Corps to sponsor recruitment or educational events associated with Drum Corps International, Bands of America, or Winterguard International from FY22 - the present. 

2. Any budget justifications or program analysis records associated with the budgets and expenditures of the USMC or USMC Drum & Bugle Corps for the activities associated with DCI, BOA, or WGI events from FY22 - present.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Free

communications.subject: Your FOIA Request 2025-USMCFOIA-006568
communications.communication:
Good Morning Mr. Free, 

This is to acknowledge the receipt of your request and to let you know that I am the analyst assigned for processing. 

Please be aware that, whenever a FOIA requester has not received a determination within 20 working days from the date a request is perfected, they are entitled to challenge the delay.  To do this, you may submit an appeal within the SecureRelease online portal (www.securerelease.us) or by writing to the Department of the Navy, Office of the Judge Advocate General (Code 14), 1322 Patterson Ave SE, Suite 3000, Washington Navy Yard, DC 20374-5066.  If you prefer, you can also submit an appeal via email to Navy-OJAG-C14-FOIA-PA-ADMINAPPEALS@us.navy.mil.  Your appeal, if any, should include a statement indicating why you believe it should be granted.  It must be postmarked or timestamped within 90 calendar days from the date of this letter. 

Requesters also have the right to seek assistance and/or dispute resolution services from the Department of the Navy FOIA Public Liaison, Mr. Christopher Julka, at Christopher.a.julka.civ@us.navy.mil or (703) 697-0031, and may also contact the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) for assistance and/or dispute resolution at ogis@nara.gov or (877) 684-6448. 

Thank you for your patience as we work to complete the processing of your request.  Hope you have a great day. 

Sincerely, 
Tara M. Walters 

Commandant of the Marine Corps (ARSF) 
Headquarters US Marine Corps 
3000 Marine Corps Pentagon Rm 2B289 
Washington DC 20350-3000 

FOIA/PA Phone:  (703) 614-4008  DSN:  224 
Fax:  (703) 614-6287 
FOIA Email:  hqmcfoia@usmc.mil

If you have any questions, please feel free to reach out to Ms. Maria Gonzalez at (maria.e.gonzalez2@usmc.mil) or 703-906-4352. 

Sincerely, 
Tara M. Walters

title: Diversity, Equity, Inclusion materials (Voorheesville Central School District)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Diversity, Equity, Inclusion materials (Voorheesville Central School District)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

All materials and correspondence between the district Board of Education, district Administration, district Equity Committee or Office, Faculty, Staff, Third Party Contractors and Consultants related to the following terms, subjects or concepts between April 2021 to the date this request is fulfilled:

Race
Anti-racism
Racism
Equity
Culturally Responsive
Decolonize
Diversity
Implicit Bias
Intersectionality
Microaggression
Oppression
Patriarchy
People of Color
Privilege(d)
Safe Space
Social Justice
Tokenism
White Supremacy

This request shall also include any teachings of such curriculum mentioned above by any faculty employed within the school district, third party contractors, consultants or other third parties invited by the school or agents of the school.

This request shall also include any documents or materials accessed by the school district, but stored on third party service providers on behalf of the district, and links/references/credentials for access to such materials if present in emails or electronic systems or files stored in browser caches, cloud storage (i.e. Google Drive, Dropbox, OneDrive, etc), or local hard drives managed by the district. This request shall also include non-school email and texting services used by the district, board, administration and faculty to conduct activities and business related to the school district (i.e. Gmail, Outlook, etc).

This request shall also include any training material or supplemental information provided to district staff, whether required or suggested.

Please keep in mind, pursuant to the Retention and Disposition Schedule for New York Local Government Records (LGS-01): Any record listed in the LGS-01 Schedule for which a Freedom of Information (FOIL) request has been received should not be destroyed until that request has been answered and until any potential appeal is made and resolved, even if the retention period of the record has passed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker
